location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 405: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: This letter concerns the Agent at Shiraz, Mirza Mahmood. Samuel Hennell reports that, after a long and patient investigation, no doubt remains of the Agent's criminality in having taken and sold for his own benefit a gold watch belonging to the late Mr Tasker. Hennell states that, following instructions from Her Majesty's Minister at the Court of Persia, Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil, he has removed Mirza Mahmood from his position as Government Agent at Shiraz and has nominated Mirza Fusl Ollah as his replacement. Hennell encloses a copy of Sheil's letter of instructions, dated 8 October 1850. The enclosure is not included, but Sheil's letter does appear earlier in the file (see ff.181-185).
